article.headline: American University 73, Lafayette 59
article.story: EASTON, Pa. (AP) -- Andre Ingram hit six of American's 10 3-pointers and finished with 23 points in a 73-59 victory over Lafayette on Saturday. Travis Lay added 15 points and Arvydas Eitutavicius had 13 for American (11-10, 3-4 Patriot League), which shot 10-for-22 from 3-point range and finished with a 37-27 rebounding advantage. Matt Betley and Andrew Brown each scored 12 points for Lafayette (8-14, 2-5). American trailed by five points midway through the first half before going on a 10-0 run and building a 32-28 lead by the break. Leading by four points with just under nine minutes remaining in the second half, American widened its lead with four free throws on consecutive possessions, a 3-pointer by Eitutavicius and a putback by Lay for an 8-0 run and a 60-48 lead with 5:33 remaining. Lafayette shot 43 percent from the field (20-for-47), including 7-for-22 from 3-point range.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
